LanguageData.AEXP_Beagle.label: beagle
LanguageData.AEXP_Beagle.description: A small scent hound developed primarily to hunt hares. It's intelligence and loyalty make it a valuable companion on the hunt.
LanguageData.AEXP_Beagle_Leather.label: beagle leather
LanguageData.AEXP_Beagle_Meat.label: dog meat
LanguageData.AEXP_Beagle_Corpse.label: beagle corpse
LanguageData.AEXP_Chihuahua.label: chihuahua
LanguageData.AEXP_Chihuahua.description: A smallest dog, just a little bit bigger than a rat. Back in ancient times considered to be reincarnations of different deities and are to this day considered sacred.
LanguageData.AEXP_Chihuahua_Leather.label: chihuahua leather
LanguageData.AEXP_Chihuahua_Corpse.label: chihuahua corpse
LanguageData.AEXP_Corgi.label: corgi
LanguageData.AEXP_Corgi.description: Historically used for cattle herding, Corgis quickly became popular on imperial worlds and are recognized as a symbol of royalty.
LanguageData.AEXP_Corgi_Leather.label: corgi leather
LanguageData.AEXP_Corgi_Corpse.label: corgi corpse
LanguageData.AEXP_FrenchBulldog.label: french bulldog
LanguageData.AEXP_FrenchBulldog.description: Originally used for bull-baiting, which is an act of pitting one species of animal against bulls, these bulldogs are fierce opponents and due to their small body-size, they are fast, agile and lethal.
LanguageData.AEXP_FrenchBulldog_Leather.label: french bulldog leather
LanguageData.AEXP_FrenchBulldog_Corpse.label: french bulldog corpse
LanguageData.AEXP_GermanShepherd.label: german shepherd
LanguageData.AEXP_GermanShepherd.description: A large sized working dog. Easy to train and good at following instructions, they are often seen accompanying glitterworld police forces and rimworld farmers.
LanguageData.AEXP_GermanShepherd_Leather.label: german shepherd leather
LanguageData.AEXP_GermanShepherd_Corpse.label: german shepherd corpse
LanguageData.AEXP_GreatDane.label: great dane
LanguageData.AEXP_GreatDane.description: One of the largest species of dogs, Great Danes are dignified, elegant and strong.
LanguageData.AEXP_GreatDane_Leather.label: great dane leather
LanguageData.AEXP_GreatDane_Corpse.label: great dane corpse
LanguageData.AEXP_Poodle.label: poodle
LanguageData.AEXP_Poodle.description: Large, pampered dogs, historically used for bird hunting, now mostly residing in imperial palaces and royal gardens.
LanguageData.AEXP_Poodle_Leather.label: poodle leather
LanguageData.AEXP_Poodle_Corpse.label: poodle corpse
LanguageData.AEXP_Pug.label: pug
LanguageData.AEXP_Pug.description: A small dog with physically distinctive features of a wrinkly, short-muzzled face, and curled tail. They are known for being extremely social and friendly, however due to years of genetic alterations they have a very short lifespan. Whatever life they have, they will always cheer up people around them.
LanguageData.AEXP_Pug_Leather.label: pug leather
LanguageData.AEXP_Pug_Corpse.label: pug corpse
LanguageData.AEXP_Rottweiler.label: rottweiler
LanguageData.AEXP_Rottweiler.description: A large domestic dog and one of the oldest herding breeds. Being one of the most hard working dogs, it is a perfect companions for farmers and cattle herders.
LanguageData.AEXP_Rottweiler_Leather.label: rottweiler leather
LanguageData.AEXP_Rottweiler_Corpse.label: rottweiler corpse
LanguageData.AEXP_Shih-Tzu.label: shih-tzu
LanguageData.AEXP_Shih-Tzu.description: An oriental toy dog, Shih-Tzu have extremely long and soft hair. While they are kind of useless, petting them provides people with great comfort.
LanguageData.AEXP_Shih-Tzu_Leather.label: shih-tzu leather
LanguageData.AEXP_Shih-Tzu_Corpse.label: shih-tzu corpse
LanguageData.AEXP_WelshTerrier.label: welsh terrier
LanguageData.AEXP_WelshTerrier.description: A hunting dog, welsh terriers are perfect for small rodents, foxes and badgers. Due to their intelligence they are perfect at way-finding, always able to return home after running into the woods.
LanguageData.AEXP_WelshTerrier_Leather.label: welsh terrier leather
LanguageData.AEXP_WelshTerrier_Corpse.label: welsh terrier corpse
